intro: Licaria peckii, commonly known as the Peck's licaria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
